verb.description: Inspect (someone or something) in detail to determine their nature or condition; investigate thoroughly.
examples: a doctor examined me and said I might need a caesarean
this forced us to examine every facet of our business

verb.description: Test the knowledge or proficiency of (someone) by requiring them to answer questions or perform tasks.
examples: the colleges set standards by examining candidates

origin: Middle English: from Old French examiner, from Latin examinare weigh, test, from examen examination.
